etymology.description: Phonetic: 已(已) (yǐ) + Semantic: 廾(廾, "two hands") = conveying a sense of holding or presenting something different
etymology.interpretation: 異(异) (yì, "different") combines the pronunciation of 已(已) (yǐ) with the idea of 'hands bringing forward or separating' from 廾(廾), suggesting something being brought forth as 'different.'

examples.chinese: 他的设计异于常规(他的設計異於常規)，独具匠心(獨具匠心)。
examples.pinyin: tā de shèjì yì yú chángguī, dú jù jiàngxīn.
examples.english: His design is different from the norm, uniquely ingenious.

examples.chinese: 这个观点异于传统(這個觀點異於傳統)，引人深思(引人深思)。
examples.pinyin: zhè ge guāndiǎn yì yú chuántǒng, yǐn rén shēnsī.
examples.english: This viewpoint differs from tradition, provoking deep thought.
